PhysX for Virtools » Building Blocks » Joints


PJAddLimitPlane is categorized in Joints

Description

Apply to a 3DEntity
Adds a limit plane.

See PJPointInPlane.cmo.

Technical Information

This building blocks invokes pJoint::setLimitPoint() and afterwards pJoint::addLimitPlane() internally.

In: triggers the process.

Out: is activated when the process is completed.

Body B: The second body. Leave blank to create a joint constraint with the world.

Joint Type: The joint type. This helps the building block to identify a joint constraint. As usual there can be only one joint of the type x between two bodies.

Restitution: Restitution of the limit plane.

  • Range: [0,1.0f)
  • Default: 0.0

Limit Point:The point specified in global coordinate frame.

  • Range: [Position Vector)

Limit Point Reference:Reference to transform limit point (local) into world space.

Point is Body B:Set to true if the point is attached to the second actor.Otherwise it is attached to the first.

Point in Plane:Point in the limit plane in global coordinates.

  • Range: [Position Vector)

Point in Plane Reference:Reference to transform plane "Point in Plane"(local then) into global coordinates.

Normal:Normal for the limit plane in global coordinates.

  • Range: [Position Vector)

Normal Reference:Reference to transform plane "Normal"(local up then) into global coordinates.

VSL : Creation 


PhysicManager pm = GetPhysicManager();

pJoint joint  = pm.getJoint(bodyARef,bodyBRef,JT_PointInPlane);
if(!joint)
    return;

//  Limit plane normal
Vector normalOut  = normal;
if (normalReference)
{
    Vector dir;
    Vector up;
    Vector right;
    normalReference.GetOrientation(dir,up,right);
    normalReference.TransformVector(normalOut,up);
}

//  Point in Plane
Vector   pipOut = pointInPlane;
if(pointInPlaneReferemce)
    pointInPlaneReferemce.Transform(pipOut,pointInPlane);


joint.addLimitPlane(normalOut,pipOut,restitution);

Is utilizing pRigidBody pWorld PhysicManager joint::setLimitPoint() joint::addLimitPlane()
